qas.question: Which of two can be more efficiently electricified?
How can electric power plant become more power efficient?

answers.text: it will shut down its least efficient generators

qas.question: How can electric train be more energy efficient?
Which type of train continues to use energy while coasting or being stopped?
What causes electric trains to waste energy?

plausible_answers.text: in non-nominal regimes at low power

qas.question: Diesel motors increase in efficiency where?
Electric rolling stock may use heating blowers when?
What can often be generated with a lower efficiency?
If an electric power plant needs to generate more power it shuts down what?
The diesel train can save energy by regenerative what?

context: <a0_0><b7_0>Central station<a0_0/> electricity<b7_0/> can often be generated with higher efficiency than a mobile engine/generator. While the efficiency of power plant generation and diesel locomotive generation are roughly the same in the nominal regime, diesel motors decrease in efficiency <b5_0>in non-nominal regimes at low power<b5_0/>  while if an electric power plant needs to generate less power <a1_0>it will shut down <b8_0>its least efficient generators<b8_0/><a1_0/>, thereby increasing efficiency. The electric train can save energy (as compared to diesel) <a2_0>by regenerative <b9_0>braking<b9_0/><a2_0/> and by not needing to consume energy by idling as <a3_0>diesel<a3_0/> locomotives do when stopped or coasting. However, electric rolling stock may run <a4_0>cooling blowers<a4_0/> <b6_0>when stopped or coasting<b6_0/>, thus consuming energy.
